channel.title: Microsoft Attacks OpenOffice
channel.description:
http://wimp.com/attacksopenoffice/
Nothing like putting down an open source solution by saying it costs more money to use!

item.title: Microsoft Attacks OpenOffice
item.dc:creator: @IlikeArrays IlikeArrays
item.description:
@IlikeArrays wrote:

I like Microsoft office more because I grew up with it and its my thing. That is until they tried making things look all pretty in the 2007-10 issues of it. I love the earlier versions though. OpenOffice I used on my pc when I reformatted and I wanted something for free. I really did not have any problems with it. Viewing that video just shows that whoever made the video is just full of themselves.

Read full topic

item.title: Microsoft Attacks OpenOffice
item.dc:creator: @Mr.Chris Mr.Chris
item.description:
@Mr.Chris wrote:

So far in to my Uni course i’ve been using nothing but Ubuntu and Open Office and have encountered 0 problems. On a scale of 1 to homo, i’d give MS Office a Bisexual and OOffice a complete straight.

Read full topic

item.title: Microsoft Attacks OpenOffice
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Price is quite a huge advantage, yes. But it has more than that, such as open standards, and cross platform compatibility (running Linux, Microsoft Office isn’t an option), just off the top of my head.

I went through 5 years of college using nothing but Open Office with no problems what so ever, I never encountered anything I needed to do and couldn’t. In fact, many of my professors wanted us to turn in assignments in the Open Office format. And, towards the end of my college career after the advent of ‘docx’ ALL of my professors mandated that we NOT turn in anything with the docx format. Way to break compatibility with your own programs microsoft!

Read full topic

item.title: Microsoft Attacks OpenOffice
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

Why?

Microsoft Office beats the shit out of Open Office, Ribbon interface or not. It has one advantage, price.

Read full topic

item.title: Microsoft Attacks OpenOffice
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

super_:

speljohan is just a typical conservative. his only valid argument against the ribbon UI is that it takes time to adjust. unfortunately, this applies to just about all new technology. why don’t you just accept that the ribbon UI is just dandy and significantly flattens the learning curve? it has meaningful text annotations for different features and updated icons. not only that, it is also semantically categorized, allowing one to quickly find where something is.

It’s a valid argument because Microsoft’s argument against Open Office seems to be that it takes time to adjust to it from Microsoft Office. I think if your going to have to adjust to something anyway, might as well go to Open Office.

Read full topic

item.title: Microsoft Attacks OpenOffice
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

The ribbon itself isn’t bad, people’s problems with it come with familiarity with the old versions. Though, the ribbon did need work, and it has had that work to make a little more sense on the new releases.

item.title: Microsoft Attacks OpenOffice
item.dc:creator: @bootnecklad bootnecklad
item.description:
@bootnecklad wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:22, topic:367247”][quote author=R.I.P RSC link=topic=463424.msg3390663#msg3390663 date=1288898539]
I’m pretty much stuck to Office for schoolwork. We even have a teacher, who teaches EDP auditing, that still works with Office 2000.
[/quote]
Office 2000 is much easier to use than the new UI stuff introduced in (I think) Office 2007, what about all the re-training necessary to upgrade to office 2007 and then 2010, it would be the same amount needed to upgrade to OpenOffice.[/quote]

[quote=“Speljohan, post:23, topic:367247”][quote author=Greeny link=topic=463424.msg3390665#msg3390665 date=1288898680]

We even have a teacher, who teaches EDP auditing, that still works with Office 2000.

That is… tragic.
[/quote]brilliant* at least there’s no dumb ribbon layout!

We had both microsoft office and openoffice during college on all pc’s, You could use either one.[/quote]

brb finding my post on office related things, will edit…

Read full topic
